title: School admission lottery today
body: The digital lottery for the admission of students from Class I to Class IX to all government and non-government secondary schools in metropolitan cities, sadar upazilas in districts and other upazila headquarters across Bangladesh will be held today (Thursday) at 10:00am. This year, against 11,94,513 seats in these institutions, 10,56,054 students filed 16,34,754 applications for admission in 721 government and 6,780 non-government schools, said the Directorate of Secondary and Higher Education’s director (secondary wing) Professor Khan Moinuddin Al Mahmud Sohel. Khan Moinuddin also said that the number of applications was higher for admission to the government schools. Under the central digital lottery system, the lottery programme will start at 10:00am at the International Mother Language Institute in the capital. The lottery programme will be broadcasted live by the Directorate of Secondary and Higher Education’s Facebook page (http://www.facebook.com/dshe.moebd), print media and different television channels. After the conclusion of the lottery process, the school authorities, the guardians and the students can download the results using their identifications and passwords from the https://gsa.teletalk.com.bd link. The directorate instructed the heads of the educational institutions to inform the results to the directorate after emailing the results to the concerned district and upazila admission committees. Then the heads of the educational institutions would call the meeting of the admission committees and take initiatives for admission following due procedures. The instructions of the directorate have been sent to all principals and head teachers of the educational institutions concerned.
